DOC.brief_summary: This protocol explore feasibility acceptability use two daily diary method analyze state-dependent variable psychosocial health outcome Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) -positive young men sex men ( YMSM ) . The study explore potential diary use feedback-based intervention .
DOC.criteria: Receives service one select Adolescent Medicine Trial Unit ( AMTU ) sit ; HIV1 infection document participant 's medical record least one follow criterion : Reactive HIV screen test result antibodybased , Food Drug Administration ( FDA ) license assay follow positive supplemental assay ( e.g. , HIV1 Western Blot , HIV1 indirect immunofluorescence ) ; Positive HIV1 deoxyribonucleic acid ( DNA ) polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) assay ; Plasma HIV1 quantitative ribonucleic acid ( RNA ) assay > 1,000 copies/mL ; Positive plasma HIV1 RNA qualitative assay Between age 1624 year , inclusive , time screening ; Born biologically male selfidentifies male time screen ; HIVinfected sexual behavior ; At least one selfreported sexual encounter another man involve oral anal sex past 12 month prior screen ; At least one selfreported episode unprotected vaginal anal intercourse within past 90 day prior screen and/or substance use , define least one occasion four alcoholic beverage consume and/or two occasion illicit drug use , past 90 day , assess Assessment Substance Use Sexual Behavior questionnaire ( CRF ( F107 ) ) ; Has active cell phone service ; able access cell phone seven day week 6:00 PM 6:00 AM next morning ; willing able use approximately 10 minute talk time receive two text message per day ; Consistent internet access seven day week 6:00 PM 6:00 AM next morning ; Ability understand , read , speak English ; Ability read fifth grade level , assess Rapid Estimate Adolescent Literacy Medicine ( REALM ) TEEN ; Willingness provide sign informed consent study participation . HIV infect via mode sexual behavior ( e.g. , perinatally , via share needle , blood transfusion , etc . ) ; Previously enrol Adolescent Trials Network ( ATN ) 112 ; Active psychiatric condition opinion site Principal Investigator ( PI ) designee would interfere ability give true informed consent adhere study requirement ; Visibly distraught and/or visibly emotionally unstable ( e.g. , exhibit suicidal , homicidal , impulsive violent behavior ) ; Active drug alcohol use dependence , opinion site personnel , would interfere ability give true informed consent adhere study requirement ; Acute illness , opinion treat clinician , would interfere participant 's ability adhere protocol requirement and/or interfere protocol objective .
